definition: straight/to straighten/fair and reasonable/frank/straightforward/(indicates continuing motion or action)/vertical/vertical downward stroke in Chinese characters
surname Zhi/Zhi (c. 2000 BC), fifth of the legendary Flame Emperors 炎帝[Yan2 di4] descended from Shennong 神農|神农[Shen2 nong2] Farmer God

sentences.english: Please tell me your opinion frankly.
Mulroy bluntly forced citizens to use less water.
sentences.chinese: 马尔罗伊率直地强迫人们用更少的水。

sentences.english: She bounced out that she didn't like to dance with you.
sentences.chinese: 她率直地说她不喜欢和你一起跳舞。

sentences.english: Abrupt and often disconcertingly frank in speech.
sentences.chinese: 说话率直的，不转弯抹角的。

sentences.english: They're quite expensive, though. Frankly, I draw a line at spending much for gloves.
sentences.chinese: 它们太贵了率直的说，买手套儿花几多钱，我有限度。

sentences.english: The women in the group were style-conscious and outspoken.
sentences.chinese: 这些女性注重时尚，坦率直言。

sentences.english: Please tell me frankly your opinion.
Kahn has never been anything if not outspoken .
sentences.chinese: 卡恩向来都是坦率直言的。

sentences.english: It was his ingenuous smile that won Deborah's heart.
sentences.chinese: 是他率直的微笑赢得了黛博拉的芳心。

sentences.english: The US is failing to lead on the environment, Sarkozy says bluntly.
sentences.chinese: 萨尔科奇率直地说美国没能在环境问题上牵头。

definition: frank and outspoken (idiom)/straight speaking/to say what one thinks
open and candid (idiom); not hiding anything/ingenuous
to make a clear difference between what one likes and what one hates/to have well-defined likes and dislikes
to stop at nothing (idiom)/to dare to do anything
